intro: Discocalyx papuana, commonly known as the Papuan discocalyx, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive disc-shaped calyx that persists through flowering. Its flowers are typically pink or red and are borne on slender stalks. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
